title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.7.45-46 | 19-01-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyanati Mirandasya Gyananjanishalakaya Chaksharunminitam Yena Tasmait Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale Shri Mate Bhaktivedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatyade Shatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naramchaiva Narottamam
Devi Saraswati Vyasa Tato Jayam Udi Raye
In this session we will be discussing from the 45th and the 46th verses of the 7th chapter of 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
Saesha Bhagavang Dronaha Praja Rupena Vartate Tasyatmano Urdham Patnyaste Nanvagad Veerasu Kripi
The meaning of this verse is
His wife Kripi did not undergo a sati with him
Gravapati is explaining the reason why Ashwatthama should not be killed
She is coming up with so many different arguments
here she is saying that she is not a good person
She is telling Dronacharya he died in the battle
but he is still existing because he is represented by his son
and Dronacharya is referred out of respect by Draupadi as Bhagavan Dronaha Saesha Bhagavata
Dronacharya is referred out of respect by Draupadi as Bhagavan Dronaha Saesha Bhagavata

So it is explained by Srila Prabhupada in the purport, the wife of Dronacharya, Krippi, is a sister of Krippacharya, a devoted wife, who is according to the revealed scripture, the better half of her husband, is justified in embracing voluntary death along with her husband, if she is without issue.
But in the case of the wife of Dronacharya, she did not undergo such a trial, because she had her son, the representative of her husband.
So Srila Prabhupada explains, a widow is a widow only in name, if there is a son of her husband existing.
So in either case, Ashwathama was a representative of Dronacharya, and therefore killing Ashwathama would be like killing Dronacharya.
The argument of Draupadi against the killing of Ashwathama.
The meaning of this verse is,
O most fortunate one, who knows the principles of religion, it is not good for you to cause grief to glorious family members, who are always respectable and worshipful.
So Srila Prabhupada says, in the purport to this 46th verse,
A slight insult for a respectable family is sufficient to invoke grief.
Therefore, a cultured man should always be careful in dealing with worshipful family members.
So Srila Prabhupada has explained elaborately these two verses in a discourse he had given earlier.
The point explained by Prabhupada, especially with reference to these two verses, is that what is the position of Dronacharya in the life of the Pandavas.
Dronacharya is accepted as Guru by the Pandavas.
They were trained up by Dronacharya.
They were trained up by Dronacharya.
And Dronacharya, especially as required by the Pandavas.
As regards Arjuna, Dronacharya taught all the secrets.
And already Draupadi has pointed out,
It is only by the mercy of Dronacharya that you learnt all the secrets about Dhanur Vidya or Dhanur Veda.
So Draupadi is not an ordinary woman.
She knows everything about religious principles.
And therefore she is teaching the assembly of respectable learned persons how the spiritual master should be respected.
She herself is referring to Dronacharya as Bhagawan Drona.
Anyone who is extraordinarily powerful is addressed as Bhagawan.
Sometimes Narada is addressed as Bhagawan.
Sometimes Lord Shiva is addressed as Bhagawan.
They are all extraordinarily powerful personalities.
The definition given by Parashara Muni in the Shastra is who is Bhagawan.
One who possesses the sum total of all the wealth and the other opulences.
One who possesses the sum total of all the wealth and the other opulences.
Sum total of all the six opulences possessed by Krishna, Bhagawan Krishna.
But there are others who are not exactly in the position of Krishna as supreme.
But they are also having certain extent the same qualities as Krishna.
The qualities of Bhagawan they have.
So in that sense they also can be addressed as Bhagawan.
Because they are extraordinarily powerful compared to other persons.
But they are not having Samagra Aishwarya.
They are not having the sum total of all the wealth.
So that position possessing the sum total of all the wealth is held only by one person.
So she is telling he is extraordinarily powerful personality.
Praja means offspring son or daughter.
So one who is born of the father.
Now without father there is no possibility of any birth taking place.
Praja is the product of the body of the father.
Is actually present in the form of the son or daughter.
The seed is given by the father.
And just like you sow a seed in the ground.
Then a huge tree comes up.
But that seed again grows up to be a tree.
The seed is put by the father in the womb of the mother.
You sow a seed in the ground.
The seed is sown in the womb of the mother.
And the mother takes care of the seed.
And becomes a big body and comes out.
This is the process of birth.
The seed and the tree there is no difference.
In the form of his son.
This is very important to understand.
A woman who has got a son.
She is not considered a widow.
A woman who doesn't have a husband.
If the husband's representative is there.
The woman is not a widow.
To understand we completely understand it in.
Why as we have heard it coming.
So Radha and Krishna have combined in the form of Chaitanya Mahaprabhu.
So in the same way, the wife is considered the better half of the husband, Ardhangini.
In so many ways, Draupadi is trying to convince, don't think Dronacharya is dead and gone.
So killing the son of Dronacharya means killing Dronacharya.
So do not do this. This is Draupadi's argument.
And one should act in such a way.
That the action will always be glorified in the family.
Now Pandava's family is a very respectable family.
So Draupadi is telling also, if you know the principles of religion,
you will not perform any action which will bring down the glory of the family.
You should not do such an action.
So therefore, you should take care in dealing with the family members of Dronacharya.
So there will be further reasons given by Draupadi why Ashwathama should not be killed.
That will be explained in the next verse.
Earlier also Prabhupada had mentioned in the Purport that she is a pure devotee.
Therefore, even though she is aggrieved because of the loss of her sons.
She is thinking not just of her own problem.
She is thinking how Krippi will be put into so much of grief.
She has already lost her husband.
If you kill Ashwathama, she is going to be put into so much more grief.
So Draupadi has all such considerations.
Being a Vaishnavi, being a devotee, a pure devotee, not just a devotee, a pure devotee.
